H0.text: A graph is what students should use to identify the percent chance of a trait being passed down from a parent to its offspring.

H1.text: A flow chart is what students should use to identify the percent chance of a trait being passed down from a parent to its offspring.

H2.text: A data table is what students should use to identify the percent chance of a trait being passed down from a parent to its offspring.

H3.text: A Punnett square is what students should use to identify the percent chance of a trait being passed down from a parent to its offspring.

A4.text: The Punnett square is a square diagram that is used to predict the genotypes of a particular cross or breeding experiment. It is named after Reginald C. Punnett, who devised the approach in 1905. The diagram is used by biologists to determine the probability of an offspring having a particular genotype.
